result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Marie Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) Court waived all other Court costs.
3) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $50 per month to probation.
4) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1) The defendant shall continue with her after-care treatment/programming.
2) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.
3) The defendant shall continue taking all medications prescribed to her as prescribed.
No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica Marie Johnson

records.addlTxt: Returned JOC.  "Return to Sender, Not deliverable as addressed, Unable to Forward."

11:56 AM Cases 21CF151 and 22CF31 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jessica Marie Johnson in court.  Attorney Eugene Harrington in court for Jessica Marie Johnson with authority to represent on both files today. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: def pleading to amended possession of amphetamine in each file; 1 year probation. State moves to amend the methamphetamine counts to amphetamine counts (misdemeanors) Count 3 of 21CF151 and Count 1 of 22CF31; Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 3 of 21CF151 and Count 1 of 22CF31 as amended and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 1 yr probation, withheld sentence
Conditions of probation:  Continue after care treatment, regular drug testing, No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Continue taking meds as prescribed.  Court orders DNA only- $200 for each charge- $50/month until paid off in full.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Parties to obtain jail credit within 7 days.  Report to probation immediately.  
DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Appeal rights provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:34 AM Cases 21CF151 and 22CF31 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jessica Marie Johnson in court.  Attorneys Gabriel Andres Pollak and Eugene Harrington in court for Jessica Marie Johnson.  In 22CF31- atty Harrington updates: def completed programming and is to provide proof, changing the offer of the State; case likely to resolve.  Atty Pollak updates in 21CF151, case also likely to resolve.  State provides information regarding the agreement and basis; also believes they will resolve.  Atty Harrington notes- willing to take both these cases to aid in getting the resolution hearing scheduled.  Court to remove the 6/16/22 FPT from calendar.  State reserves right to amend the Information beyond the final pre-trial date that was set; court approves.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:12 AM Cases 21CF151 and 22CF31 called together.  Defendant, Jessica Marie Johnson, appeared with Attorney Eugene Harrington on 22CF31 and in place of Gabriel Andres Pollak in 21CF151 today.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: offer received, needs to discuss with the other attorney.  Atty Harrington recites the offer- plead to 1 and 3 of 22CF31, DRI balance, PSI, parties free to argue.  Def makes a statement regarding programming and personal matters.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Jessica Marie Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney by separate video means.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over. Bond will continue. State efiles information which mirrors the criminal complaint.  2022CF31 Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 02:52 PM Cases 21CF151 and 22CF31 called together.  Defendant Jessica Marie Johnson in court with attorneys Gabriel Andres Pollak and Eugene Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF31 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  NG pleas entered to misdemeanor charges.  Witness makes statement regarding programming.  Court will modify the bond to signature bond with the condition that def must attend in-patient treatment.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

$250 cash component of previous bond remains posted, $350 additional cash portion converted to signature bond.  Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22GF27 (now filed as 22CF31) and 21CF151.    The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  The defendant must attend in-patient treatment.
